comments:
It appears that it has become easier to have the Ant UI tests fail from 
missing output.

Darins,
Is this the test failure you're referring to? If so we appear to be getting more output than expected (not 
less). Possibly we're counting lines from more than one test, or from the wrong test? So far I haven't 
been able to reproduce this locally.

Created an attachment (id=17108)
ConsoleLineTracker patch

Small synchronization change. init() was synchronized on "this" while every
thing else was synchronized on the lines ArrayList. This could account for
problem in the case where a second launch was occuring before the previous
launch had terminated its console.

Darins can you apply the patch for me? I'm unable to commit to ant.tests.ui for
some reason.

Seems to be happening less frequently now, but there is still an occasional failure.

from N20050116-0010:
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Incorrect number of messages logged for build. Should be 14. 
Was 1
at org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui.separateVM.SeparateVMTests.testProjectHelp(SeparateVMTests.java:168)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui.AbstractAntUIBuildTest.access$0(AbstractAntUIBuildTest.java:1)
at org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui.AbstractAntUIBuildTest$1.run(AbstractAntUIBuildTest.java:45)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Some of the Ant Tests extend AbstractAntUITest and call it's launch methods. These methods do not 
call ConsoleLineTracker.waitForConsole(). This can result in a second test starting before the console 
has caught up with the output from the previous test.

released changes to AbstractAntUIBuildTest, AbstractAntUITest, and ConsoleLineTracker.

All launch methods eventually call AbstractAntUITest.launchAndWait(...). Moved the call to 
ConsoleLineNotifier.waitForBuild() to that method and removed it from other launch methods.

I believe this solves the transient failures. Will watch the Nightlies this week before closing this bug 
down.

Definitely happening less now. Been about a week since last failure. However, in last night's build 
(N20050126-0010):
